Detailed Description

Component Manager Introspection API.

This file contains the Component Manager API for introspect components.

Function Documentation

PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentDescription ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
char *  templateName,
t_uint32  templateNameLength,
t_nmf_core_id *  coreId,
char *  localName,
t_uint32  localNameLength,
t_nmf_ee_priority *  priority 
)

Get a component description.

Get some description about the component:

  • the component template name,
  • the core where the component is loaded,
  • the component local name (gived during instantiation).

This method can be used like this: 

   t_cm_instance_handle component;
   t_cm_error error;
   t_nmf_core_id coreId;
   char templateName[MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH];
   char localName[MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH];

   error = CM_GetComponentDescription(component,
        templateName, MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH, &coreId,
        localName, MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH);
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] templateName Address of buffer where component template name mut be write.
[in] templateNameLength Size of templateName buffer.
[out] coreId The core where the component is loaded.
[in] localName Address of buffer where component local name mut be write.
[in] localNameLength Size of localName buffer.
[out] priority The priority of the component (optional, may be NULL).
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentListHeader ( t_cm_instance_handle *  headerComponent  ) 

Get a component created by the process.

Return a loaded component of the instantiated component network.

This method can be used to obtain a component that can be used as an entry point for browsing instantiated component network (used conjointly with CM_GetComponentListNext).

This code illustrate how browsing component network: 

   t_cm_instance_handle component;

   CM_GetComponentListHeader(&component);
   while(component != 0) {
      t_nmf_core_id coreId;
      char templateName[MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH];
      char localName[MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH];

      CM_GetComponentDescription(component, templateName, MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH, &coreId, localName, MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH);
      LOG("[%x] type=%s dsp=%d name=%s",
          component, templateName, coreId, localName);

      CM_GetComponentListNext(component, &component);
   }
Parameters:
[out] headerComponent The instance of a component loaded by the process (null if the no component loaded)
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentListNext ( const t_cm_instance_handle  prevComponent,
t_cm_instance_handle *  nextComponent 
)

Get a next component.

Return a next component in the instantiated component network.

This method may be called repeatedly to iterate through the network components. The list resulting from calling this method is ordered by date of instantiation.

See CM_GetComponentListHeader for detail about how this method can be used.

Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
Parameters:
[in] prevComponent A component instance handle
[out] nextComponent The instance of a next component loaded by the process (null if the last one)
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentMemoryInfo ( const char *  templateName,
t_cm_component_memory_info *  pInfo 
)

Get component memory info.

Get the information about how much memory the compnent would occupy after its instantiation. All memory types are accounted for and two instantiation types are considered

  • initial instantiation, and
  • subsequent instantiations.
Parameters:
[in] templateName The component name.
[out] pInfo The info structure gathering all above information
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentPropertyName ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const t_uint8  index,
char *  propertyName,
t_uint32  propertyNameLength 
)

Return the name of a property.

Return the name of a property that have been declared in the component configuration file according its index.

See CM_GetComponentPropertyNumber for detail about how this method can be used.

Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] index Property index.
[in] propertyName Address of buffer where property name mut be write.
[in] propertyNameLength Size of propertyName buffer.
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_PROPERTY The property index is out of range [0 .. numberProperties[.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentPropertyNumber ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
t_uint8 *  numberProperties 
)

Get number of properties of a component.

Return the number of properties that have been declared in the component configuration file.

Component introspection property methods can be used like this: 

   t_cm_instance_handle component;
   t_uint8 propertyNumber, index;

   CM_GetComponentPropertyNumber(
         component,
         &propertyNumber);

   for(index = 0; index < propertyNumber; index++) {
       char propertyName[MAX_PROPERTY_NAME_LENGTH];
       char propertyValue[MAX_PROPERTY_VALUE_LENGTH];
       CM_GetComponentPropertyName(component, index, propertyName, MAX_PROPERTY_NAME_LENGTH);
       CM_GetComponentPropertyValue(component, propertyName, propertyValue, MAX_PROPERTY_VALUE_LENGTH);

       LOG("Property %s = %s\n", propertyName, propertyValue);
   }
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[out] numberProperties The number of properties.
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentPropertyValue ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const char *  propertyName,
char *  propertyValue,
t_uint32  propertyValueLength 
)

Get property value of a component.

Get the property value of a component. This property must have been declared as an property in the component configuration file.

This method can be used like this: 

   t_cm_instance_handle component;
   t_cm_error error;
   char value[MAX_PROPERTY_VALUE_LENGTH];

   error = CM_GetComponentPropertyValue(
         component,
         "prop",
         value,
         MAX_PROPERTY_VALUE_LENGTH);

The name of the property can be either well-known for the component type or founded dynamically through CM_GetComponentPropertyNumber and CM_GetComponentPropertyName.

Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] propertyName The component property name.
[in] propertyValue Address of buffer where property value mut be write.
[in] propertyValueLength Size of propertyValue buffer.
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_PROPERTY The property name is unknown.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentProvidedInterface ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const t_uint8  index,
char *  itfName,
t_uint32  itfNameLength,
char *  itfType,
t_uint32  itfTypeLength,
t_sint16 *  collectionSize 
)

Return information about provided interface.

Return the description of a provided interface that have been declared in the component configuration file according its index.

See CM_GetComponentProvidedInterfaceNumber for detail about how this method can be used.

Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] index Provided interface index.
[in] itfName Address of buffer where name of the provided interface must be write.
[in] itfNameLength Size of itfName buffer.
[in] itfType Address of buffer where type of the provided interface must be write.
[in] itfTypeLength Size of itfType buffer.
[out] collectionSize Size of the collection (-1 if not a collection).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE The provided interface index is out of range [0 .. numberProvidedInterfaces[.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentProvidedInterfaceNumber ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
t_uint8 *  numberProvidedInterfaces 
)

Get number of interface provided by a component.

Return the number of provided interface that have been declared in the component configuration file.

Component introspection provided interface methods can be used like this: 

    t_cm_instance_handle component;
    t_uint8 provideNb, i;

    CM_GetComponentProvidedInterfaceNumber(component, &provideNb);
    for(i = 0; i < provideNb; i++) {
        char itfName[MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH];
        char itfType[MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH];
        t_sint16 collectionSize;

        CM_GetComponentProvidedInterface(component, i,
                    itfName, MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH,
                    itfType, MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH,
                    &collectionSize);

        if(collectionSize != -1)
            LOG("  <- %s:%s [%d]", itfName, itfType, collectionSize);
        else
            LOG("  <- %s:%s", itfName, itfType);
    }
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[out] numberProvidedInterfaces The number of provided interface
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentRequiredInterface ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const t_uint8  index,
char *  itfName,
t_uint32  itfNameLength,
char *  itfType,
t_uint32  itfTypeLength,
t_cm_require_state *  requireState,
t_sint16 *  collectionSize 
)

Return information about required interface.

Return the description of a required interface that have been declared in the component configuration file according its index.

See CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceNumber for detail about how this method can be used.

Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] index Required interface index.
[out] itfName Address of buffer where name of the required interface must be write.
[in] itfNameLength Size of itfName buffer.
[out] itfType Address of buffer where type of the required interface must be write.
[in] itfTypeLength Size of itfType buffer.
[out] requireState Address where the required interface state must be write.
[out] collectionSize Size of the collection (-1 if not a collection).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE The required interface index is out of range [0 .. numberRequiredInterfaces[.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceBinding ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const char *  itfName,
t_cm_instance_handle *  server,
char *  serverItfName,
t_uint32  serverItfNameLength 
)

Get the component binded to a required interface.

Return information about the interface provided by a server component that has been binded to a required interface.

See CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceNumber for detail about how this method can be used.

Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] itfName Name of the required interface.
[out] server Server component instance (NMF_HOST_COMPONENT if component on host call through MPC->Host binding).
[in] serverItfName Address of buffer where interface name provided by the server component where is bind the client component must be write.
[in] serverItfNameLength Size of serverItfName buffer.
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE The required interface name is unknown.
CM_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED The required interface is not binded.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceNumber ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
t_uint8 *  numberRequiredInterfaces 
)

Get number of interface required by a component.

Return the number of required interface that have been declared in the component configuration file.

Component introspection required interface methods can be used like this: 

    t_cm_instance_handle component;
    t_uint8 requireNb, i;

    CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceNumber(component, &requireNb);
    for(i = 0; i < requireNb; i++) {
        char itfName[MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH];
        char itfType[MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH];
        t_sint16 collectionSize;
        t_cm_instance_handle server;
        char serverItfName[MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH];

        CM_GetComponentRequiredInterface(component, i,
            itfName, MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH,
            itfType, MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH,
            &collectionSize);

        if(collectionSize == -1) {
            LOG("  -> %s:%s", itfName, itfType);

            CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceBinding(component, itfName,
                &server, serverItfName, MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH);

            if(server != NULL)
                 LOG("    [%x].%s", server, serverItfName);
        } else {
            int j;

            LOG("  -> %s:%s [%d]", itfName, itfType, collectionSize);

            for(j = 0; j < collectionSize; j++) {
                char tmpname[256];
                sprintf(tmpname, "%s[%d]", itfName, j);

                CM_GetComponentRequiredInterfaceBinding(component, tmpname,
                    &server, serverItfName, MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH);

                if(server != NULL)
                    LOG("    %d: [%x].%s", j, server, serverItfName);
            }
        }
    }
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[out] numberRequiredInterfaces The number of required interface
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetExecutiveEngineHandle ( t_cm_domain_id  domainId,
t_cm_instance_handle *  executiveEngineHandle 
)

Get the executive engine handle for given core.

Return the executive engine handle for coreId. In case executive engine is not loaded it return null.

Parameters:
[in] domainId The domain identifier for which we want the executive engine handle.
[out] executiveEngineHandle executive engine instance (null if the executive engine is not loaded)
